page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF HINXWORTH
page.content: The area around the villages of Hinxworth and Edworth is first class agricultural land. The landscape is very flat and Dutch Elm disease in the 1970's killed most of the large old trees leaving only a few oaks. The population of the area numbers about 400 most of whom have to travel to work elsewhere. It is a popular area because of its friendly village atmos- phere. It is very difficult for young people to buy properties here as all the small old cottages have been con- verted into large homes. We have virt- ually no amenities and so social life tends to be centred around the pub, the church and the village hall.Little building has been allowed so the vill- age does not change much. We no longer have a village shop and many think the village is stagnating although not all are displeased by the idea.
